body.p: “You will see a crow’s track beginning in the middle of the river “,” where one alighted. I notice such a track as this “,” where one alighted “,” and apparently struck its spread tail into the snow at the same time with its feet. I see afterward where a wing’s quills have marked the snow much like a partridge’s.”
PE 14, pg. 407/ 9 November 1858-7 April 1859 / NNPM MA 1302:34 / T vol. # XXVIII / PDF # XVII / JXI
